Reviews.Title: “Avoid it if you can”
Reviews.Author: arrianos
Reviews.Content: The first shock is when you get there and you are asked to pay at once for the entire stay and they charge you with 3/% if you pay by credit card and of course there is no such condition in their web page.The room tiny you could here everything from the next room. Very poor breakfast served in the basement! Sufocating. Very unpleasant experience. The only good thing is the location but there are plenty of hotels in the area. Paying 105 pounds per night for that place is a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rick007_12
Reviews.Content: just coming back from a second stay at piccolino hotel with a mate and have to say that both occasions were very comfortable indeed. On my first stay i was given room 8, a twin room with high ceilings and a large window and on my second stay was given room 5, again a twin with a lower ceiling and an average sized window but with a separate WC and shower en-suit. Both rooms were very clean and nicely done and had large LCD TVs. I personally preferred room 5 because of the separate shower and loo, worked well for us as when one occupied the shower the loo was available for the other occupant to use, plus the room was very quiet too. Reception was manned 24 hours so no problems with late nights out and the free wireless internet worked good. complimentary continental breakfast was included within the room rate but always missed it due to over sleeping. The icing on the cake was the staff. All were very courteous and friendly especially the lads at the reception who helped us with cab bookings and kept our luggage on departure until late evening. Always ready to help and service minded, an asset for the establishment. Thanks guys. Will be seeing you again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: nomad t
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a joke...stay away. We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and not once did the housekeeping service change our sheets or clean the room. The towels had gaping holes in them and were stained. Talking of stains, the 'white' bedsheets were pretty colourful with stains too. We had a free breakfast with our booking. I guess free is the only way they could make you have it!! There was no choice, the toasts offered to us were made with stale and yeast infected bread. Disgusting! Considering what we paid i.e. 100 euros/night, I kind of feel mugged. Would advice people to stay away from this lot!

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: william h
Reviews.Content: Me and my spouse booked Piccolino Hotel after being recommended from a friend. Our expectations were not too high as we had read some mixed reviews, however, most were positive. With a slight apprehension I called up the place and booked for 3 nights. checked in the next day in the evening and was met with a very warm welcome and we were offered a choice of hot or cold drinks while I filled in the form. We were led to our room which was located on the second floor and the the the receptionist was very kind and helped carry our luggage to the room. The room was a decent size according to London standards. It was nicely decorated, well laid out, clean, comfortable and crisp bed linen. I think the room was recently refurbished. We Loved the the original wood stained floors, gave the room a cosy homely feel. Equipped with a nice sized flat screen, plenty of lighting, ample storage and full length mirrors. What was most appreciated was the ultra sleek tea coffee station which was regularly replenished. The bathroom was not massive but spotless, functional and adequate with soap, shower gel and shampoo bottles. Breakfast was as promised, continental, with a variety of cereals, croissants, cold meat, cheese slices, fruit yoghurt, beans and hard boiled eggs with juices, tea and coffee It was served buffet style, serve your self and eat your fill type. Hot toasts were bought to your table by cheerful ladies serving breakfast. However if you prefer full English then there are many small eateries a stones throw away, serving a good fry up for under £4. The only cons are that there is no elevator, but staff are happy to help with moving luggage. Having floor boards means that you may hear some noise from people staying in the rooms above, but it was generally quieter in the night. Overall a very comfortable stay. Would thoroughly recommend the place especially for the extremely helpful and friendly staff who dealt with all our queries efficiently. Thank you. Will and Anne

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty”
Reviews.Author: billm728
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel and after carrying our luggage up three flights of stairs to our room were extremely disappointed! The carpet on the stairs was VERY dirty along with the walls and trim around the doors. The room was very small! After talking to the manager we were told we would be charged one nights lodging if we checked out. We were only in the room for five minutes! I told him the hotel was very dirty and he replied that they are a small hotel? The size of the hotel should not have anything to do with how clean it is? They were also painting and the entire place and there was a very strong odor of fresh paint. We immediately checked out and moved to another hotel on the same street. Don't be fooled by the pictures on their website, they are very misleading!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: nmathewson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good quality, especially for the price... and it's in a fantastic location. Close to two Metro stations - one being Paddington which has an express train connection to the airport. If you're up for a 30-40 minute walk, you can get to Buckingham Palace easily. Our room, although small, was more than adequate with a large wardrobe, comfortable bed, desk and ensuite. The room and bathroom was very clean, good water pressure. The service at the hotel was fantastic, the man on reception was very helpful with providing information on the area. Breakfast was a really good selection and good quality. I would recommend this hotel to any type of traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: monicad76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located within easy walking distance of Paddington Station and Hyde Park. It is pretty good value for money considering the location. Our room was on the top floor but the hotel staff were very helpful in assisting us with carrying our bags up. They were also very accommodating in allowing us to leave our bags at the hotel after check out and before our flight home. There was no aircon in the room but a fan was provided. The breakfast had a good selection for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice twin room with big tv!”
Reviews.Author: xResist
Reviews.Content: My mum & I stayed here when she came over from Australia for a visit. The staff at Piccolino were very helpful and friendly, and helped us with our VERY heavy luggage, which alot of hotels didnt bother with!. We were given a really nice fancy twin room on the 1st floor on short notice. The room we stayed in was very clean, gorgeous single beds with cream satin headboards and pretty indian/persian bed covers. It had a seperate shower and toilet and a massive LCD tv! the only downfall was the continental breakfast, if you could even call it that. It lacked alot of things! we ended up going up the road for breakfast in a cafe it was that poor quality!. If the breaky was good the hotel would have been perfect. But I would recommend It for a short stay in Paddington/Bayswater anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bubulacu
Reviews.Content: We had big expectations before arriving at the hotel. High score on Trip Advisor, nice pics on the web, what could go wrong, right?... The first feeling we got when we entered the hotel was that of a place in dire need for renovations. Walls that hadn't been painted in a good while, dirty carpet on the stairs. The room was no better. Windows with peeling paint, dirty and broken glass, blinds that were not rolling up because the chain that was supposed to be used for that purpose had long ago fell on the heater and nobody bothered to put it back (therefore we had to roll up the blinds by hand and stuff them somehow so that they wouldn't fall back). The other window wouldn't stay open, was kept open with a piece of wood stuck under the window. The shelf replacing the room table was also peeling. The wardrobe was new, though. We knew that from the fact that the plywood it was made from was not painted yet, and it still had on it the arrows showing probably where the wood was supposed to be cut. The positives were the bathroom, which was clean and relatively new, and the central location. The receptionist was also very willing to help us. Conclusion: would never stay here again, would not recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate and the best value we could find!”
Reviews.Author: kerryy90
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night to save a long journey home after a concert in Hyde Park. Great location, an easy and quick walk to Hyde Park and Paddington Station. My one complaint of this hotel was that we were informed our check in was at 1pm, but when we arrived we were told that our room would not be ready till 1.30pm. Under usual circumstances I wouldn't minded but we did have somewhere we had to be so we wanted to check in and get out again quickly, made worse by the fact that it was absolutely pouring down outside with rain. So after a half an hour wait outside in the rain I wasn't happy! The hallway and stairs were a bit grubby and in need of a good paint job, and seeing how we were on the fourth floor I think it would've been nice for somebody to offer to carry our suitcase up the stairs for us. Just something I would expect from a hotel with no lift! Other than that the room was lovely. Nice and clean, comfortable bed and TV with sky. The bathroom was small but functionable. I was just happy to pay for a london hotel below Â£100 with an en suite! Unfortunately we were so tired after the concert we didn't get up early enough for breakfast, which did seem to start and finish very early for a continental. All in all a good stay, and the best price we could find for a hotel room with an en suite. Would stay again if I needed to and only wanted a bed for the night!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid room 5!”
Reviews.Author: mathelaci
Reviews.Content: Because it has no proper windows and its damp!! It was an incredibly hot day in London, the night was hell without proper windows to open! Otherwise great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: jujuyee
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay at the Piccolino hotel. The service was wonderful. I had a back injury and was so touched when the front desk supplied multiple ice packs to help ease my discomfort. The room was snug. But after a long day of exploring around town with friends and family I was happy to come back to my cozy room and have a good nights rest. The location is wonderful. Approximately 3-4 short blocks from the tube and buses. 2 short blocks from restaurants, internet cafe, small convenient store. And an easy 8-10 minute walk to the beautiful Hyde park. Breakfast was very nice. Juice, tea, coffee, fruit, toast, beans and a few cereals to choose from. Would definitely recommend to friends on a tight budget! Can't beat the location. I don't have a great sense of direction but i found it extremely easy to get around town!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad choice near Paddington Railway Station”
Reviews.Author: sergeika30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Piccolino Hotel not for the first time. In January 2011 I spent 2 nights there in the begining of my trip and the last night in the end of the trip. This is a typical 2 star hotel in London with small but convenient rooms with narrow tube+toilet. It's is located in the historical part of the city so according to the law they are unable to have an elevator. If you stay at 5 floor, you will have to climb up through the narrow stairs. Be careful especially if you climb up with your luggage!! But this is everywhere in 2 star hotels located in old buildings in London. Pros: - Location is perfect, just 5 min walk from Paddington Railway Station and underground (1 transport zone). From there you can reach everything in London. - Also Heathrow Express and Heathrow Connect arrive at Paddington station, correspondingly 15 mins and 25 mins from the airport. So you can get to the hotel very fast!! - Fare. Sometimes you can get a double/twin room for 49 pounds for two persons. Very good for central London (breakfast included!!). Cons: - Some rooms definitely have a big problem with water - they don't almost have cold water, only hot!! It's almost impossible to take a shower!! The staff didn't fix the problem. - Tube/toilet room is too narrow. I'm not a fat guy but ... really no space!!

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff and a very decent room”
Reviews.Author: carmaine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with my better other half and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Staff at the reception is extremely helpful and friendly. The room that we stayed in was a good size double room with a very large window and the bathroom was sparkling clean. Located close to Paddington station about less then 5 minutes walking distance. Our sincerest regards to the staff who made us feel very welcoming. Breakfast on the other hand can be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Waltonj1
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel for the price especially in central London you would think they would make more of an effort I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: 8ndyW
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on the reviews and there were no unpleasant surprises. We were probably the only English people staying in the hotel, but I liked the cosmopolitan feel. Don't expect the earth, a little dated, but good value for money for the location. Hairdryer was missing so had to ask for a replacement and a little difficulty getting wifi, but these issues were dealy with promptly and courteously. We were able to leave our luggage after we checked out which is a real bonus on a short trip. Contental no frills breakfast, plenty of orange juice, toast and croissants, self service. Room was clean, bed was comfortable and the location is great for getting out and about in the centre of London when you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “not bad....”
Reviews.Author: zaika_2000
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was very poor and monotonous. Only instant coffee. No safe deposit, personal belongings can be kept in an envelope in a drawer at the reception.One of the 2 beds was broken. Besides, the room was clean, the staff - very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent: only 5 minutes walk away from Paddington Train Station and Tube Station.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Traveller__13_1978
Reviews.Content: Hotels location is pretty good, 5 min walking distance to Paddington Tube Station and to bus stop. It takes 10 min to go to Oxford Street by bus. Rooms are relatively small, but I have seen worst ones in London.. So for a double room i think room space is acceptable.. Bathroom is totally renewed and clean. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful. There is an electric heater in the rooms, so heating was no issue.. The only weird thing was the breakfast was between 7:30am - 9 am.. Usually breakfast is served until 10am. I would definately recommend this hotel and would like to stay again..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a sightseeing holiday”
Reviews.Author: mchero
Reviews.Content: I spent 14 nights in this hotel in a double room in the basement and I was satisfied with everything on the whole, only with minor problems. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone who is looking for reasonably priced solutions. The most outstanding thing about this hotel is its location: 3-5 minutes from Lancaster Gate and Paddington Stations, meaning you can choose from 5 underground lines, plus there are nearby bus stops on Bayswater Road and Praed Street. You can find a Marks & Spencer and a Sainsbury store inside Paddington Station and a Tesco about 500m from the hotel. In addition, there are good restaurants in the hotel's street. The room itself was spacious, colourful and relatively quiet, though a bit warm but there was a small fan. It had a wardrobe, a big mirror on the wall, a lot of drawers and shelves, a hair dryer and even flowers. I especially liked the several lights on the ceiling and the wifi. The ensuite bathroom was convenient, the shower was really big and some shampoo and shower gel was provided. Also, I received plenty of clean towels. During my stay I got new bedlinen 3 times but the bed was made and the rubbish was taken out every day. Breakfast is served from 7:30. It is quite copious, with cereal, toasts, eggs and fruit. I loved the bananas and the beans most. I was also allowed to use the fridge and the microwave in their kitchen as I was staying long. The staff were really nice and smiley. Especially Adnan is a great asset of the hotel, you can always turn to him if you have a problem. There was always somebody at the front desk, so I felt completely safe all the time. I also appreciated that before my journey they replied to all of my emails. The minor problems: - the bed was a bit old, the blanket was too big, thick and heavy and sometimes extremely hot so it woke me up several times at night - the room was renovated on 2-3 days, which meant changing of the washbasin, the toilet, the shower and the mirror in the bathroom. It was not a big issue in itself, but the cleaning after these works was superficial and I was left with a bathroom full of dirt and had to clean myself.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: superkn
Reviews.Content: I think the previous reviews did not reflect my stay in Piccolino because I found the hotel room quite spacious in terms of London standard. There were shampoos and shower gel supply which was not common in budget hotels. Rooms were basically clean but the hallway looked a bit untidy, though. Staff there were friendly and helpful. They could help us with our luggage when we had a room on the high floor. The continental breakfast was more than enough which included cereal, boiled eggs, beans, coffee and hot chocolate. We could also get as many toasts as we could but who would eat a lot of these early in the morning?? The free internet was also a plus to us since we needed to check emails every day. The location is very good for us and it's less than 5 min walk from Rail station.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: pookiepig
Reviews.Content: We were situated in the top two rooms. On arrival mid afternoon on a very hot June day we have to climb about 70 stairs that got narrower the higher we got and were greeted with rooms had not even been cleaned. The en-suite was ridiculously tiny, you had to literally slot yourself under the washbasin to sit on the toilet. The shower was useless, more like a dribble. The bathmat had a huge hole in it. The mattress was lumpy. To go to breakfast in the morning we had another flight of stairs to contend with as the breakfast room was in the basement. Breakfast was basic...toast, baked beans and hard boiled eggs. We will not be coming again.

Reviews.Title: “basic hotel in an ideal position”
Reviews.Author: raaaachel
Reviews.Content: very basic hotel....what you pay is what you get. it was cheaper than a travelodge for us, so comparing it on that level Id say the hotel was average. Our room smelt a bit musky, but it was soon aired out as the window didnt close properly. the tv didnt work but we didnt go to london to watch tv. for two girls staying overnight on a budget the hotel was fine, ive stayed in hostels and a lot worse!! breakfast was perfectly adequate, toast, jams and baked beans with tea and coffee. reception held our bags for us after check out so we didnt have to carry them around all day. location wise it is a five minute walk to the nearest tube line, so pretty ideal really. what you pay is what you get, and this hotel was perfectly fine for the cheap price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “A confirmed booking at the Piccolino doesn't mean you'll be staying there. Beware of their "sister hotels"”
Reviews.Author: minkymoomar
Reviews.Content: I feel I need to write this review to warn people of the possible outcome of booking a room at the Piccolino Hotel, because upon arrival you might find that you are reallocated in one of their more down-market and dated "sister hotels". Despite the fact we were arriving into Victoria and we could have booked a cheap budget room nearer our station, after much research we decided to book the Piccolino despite the distance from Victoria because of the excellent reviews the hotel has received - due to its recent refurbishment and vast facilities. I made the booking two days before arrival, through Booking.com. Upon arrival the man at reception made no apologies whatsoever about the fact that actually, we weren't staying at the Piccolino. The explanation was simply that, despite the fact the hotel had a vacancies sign in the window for that night, the hotel was fully booked - and we would be staying at the "Classic Hotel", 5 mins walk away, along a more noisy street. This is not an isolated incident, and if people check the reviews for the Classic Hotel they will find other examples of when this hotel has been used as a reallocation hotel. The room description for the Piccolino is as follows, "The hotel is recently refurbished with high standard of dÃ©cor and comfort. All our rooms are en-suite, non smoking and are tastefully appointed with private showers, private toilets, hairdryer, direct -dial telephone, color TV with DVD player, Sky Satellite , radio alarm, free wireless broadband access and hospitality/tea/ coffee tray in all rooms." It is for this reason, that the Classic Hotel was such a bitter disappointment and left us feeling cheated. The man on reception was friendly and helpful, and showed us to our room. It was dark, grim and in desperate need of a refurbishment. The dark and oppressive wallpaper was torn and peeled off the walls. The bedspread was stained and had hairs on it. The mattress was hard and so lumpy that you could see the pronounced lumps straight away. There was no Sky TV like the Piccolino - instead there was a small TV with 4 channels with terrible reception, and the inbuilt DVD player's front panel had fallen off. There was a tea and coffee tray with only one mug, no power point for the kettle and no milk. The en-suite was tiny, dirty and had no extractor so you had to shower either with the door open to steam up the bedroom or else be blinded by the steam. The light above the sink did not work, and we suspected dodgy electrics due to the buzzing and flickering of the lights in general. There were no toiletries. We couldn't sleep at night, not only due to the extremely uncomfortable mattress, but also the constant banging of water pipes above our heads. Upon arrival the room was freezing, as the radiator was stone cold. The only redeeming feature was the location and the friendly and helpful nature of the receptionist during the evening. He offered us a late checkout of 12pm to help compensate for our troubles. However the next morning told a very different story, as a different receptionist, who spent a lot of the time on his mobile phone out the front, refused to honour the late checkout, and was curt in his manner. Breakfast in the morning was advertised in the rooms as being served between 8 -9.30am. In actual fact is was served 7.30-9am. It was nice enough, with copious amounts of tea and juices, cereal, toast and boiled egg. The clean bed-sheets were stored on the chairs in the breakfast room right next to the buffet table, which was a bit slack though we thought. We were staying in London because of a gig that night. Due to us being messed around with having to change hotels, we missed half of the gig. We clock-watched the entire night due to the banging pipes, lumpy mattress and room temperature, and this ruined the following day and all we had planned. I have slept better in 1 star accommodation. I would not be complaining if I had booked this hotel at a cheaper price and seen the reviews (I wouldn't have booked the Classic anyway, based on the reviews), but we were so upset at the fact that everything was a far cry from the Piccolino, and I don't feel it is fair to reallocate without notice or apology if someone has booked what they believe to be a good hotel. In a nutshell, regardless of the budget and quality of accommodation, I like to know what I'm getting for my money.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: hbkvbz
Reviews.Content: broken beds, broken doors, windows either not closed or not opened

Reviews.Title: “Some positives, but also...”
Reviews.Author: daisyita
Reviews.Content: The hotel had some good reviews so I booked for two nights for a conference trip. The entrance hall and the stairs are a bit tired but that didn't worry me as all I cared about was the room. The room and en-suite were small but perfectly adequate for me as I only needed it to sleep! At first glance, the room was spotless and so was the bathroom. Nice shiny wooden floors and well dusted furniture too! HOWEVER: the duvet cover and the blanket were stained and covered in hair, and not just one or two - if you get the drift. When I opened the sheets there were occasional hair there too, and I almost had a fit! I asked the receptionist for a new pair of sheets and got them without any trouble. Thankfully the room - being in the 4th floor - was very warm so I survived without using the wig-like blanket. The new sheets and towels - although clean - were very old and not too appealing, but that could be overlooked. The breakfast room was nice and tidy, with a good selection of cereals, juices, coffee/tea and fresh fruit. You could have boiled eggs and a croissant as well if desired. All was accompanied by a few slices of warm white toast. I found the staff very nice and friendly, no problems there. If it wasn't for the sheets/blanket accident I would stay there again. If you book Piccolino Hotel and you're not bothered by this potential problem, you'll have a good time! It's nice and in a convenient location and everything else was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: vova4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a really "hotelino"... But clean, nice and quiet (at least our room, 4 floor). The beds are comfortable; Paddington St. and all possible busses are close... (We are goes, so from the hotel is not longer to Piccadilly than 35-40 minutes to walk...) The hotel is rather cheap (for London!), the stuff is friendly... Will probably stay again. Beata and Wladimir, Copenhagen, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Travel26
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we were going to see a band at Wembley stadium and wanted somewhere near Paddington on our return into London. The only good thing is that it is near Paddington station. The room itself was ok but the bathroom was extremely small and had a constant bad smell - of what I'm not sure - and as with the rest of the hotel, was Dirty. There was no hot water and the shower was also very dirty. The upstairs room (4 flights of stairs & no lift) was quiet but my friend who drew the short straw had a very noisy night in the room on the ground floor near reception, avoid room number 4. The buzzer to get in to the hotel is right next to this room. As for breakfast the best thing I can say is forget it. Another dirty room and some of the food looked like it had been there for weeks. Chipped glasses and cups, warm orange juice, and awful coffee. That is as far as we got with breakfast before checking out and going elsewhere for it. It's probably a place where you only want to spend one night and for a cheap hotel in London this is what to expect. I would advise on paying a little more for a clean stay in the city...

Reviews.Title: “A good home base for exploration of the city, but...”
Reviews.Author: lunazure
Reviews.Content: The Piccolino Hotel has some good qualities - friendly staff, good location - and also some less desirable ones such as crowded hallways and mice. The hotel is situated on a quiet street lined with hotels, very close to Paddington Station. The location is a great starting point for exploration of London's exciting and historic sites, and is close to Hyde Park, restaurants and pubs, and shops. The outside appearance of the hotel is quite classy, but once inside, things take on a different spin. The front desk is in a small room down a narrow hallway from the front door. During our 2 day stay, the hallway was crowded with mattresses and springs on their sides and leaning against the walls. Our party had booked 2 rooms - a double which was up several narrow flights of stairs, and a triple which was located on the lower level - again, stairs. This made hauling heavy luggage somewhat inconvenient. The rooms were reasonably sized and looked quite nice, but one of the en suites was so small it was difficult to turn around in. Each time we left the hotel we were required to turn in our keys at the front desk and pick them up again upon our return. The desk was manned 24 hours, so this was not a problem. The gentleman at the desk was very friendly and helpful, offering tips and even making calls to check prices for different modes of transportation to the airport. The young adults in our party found the hotel to be fine, but I was a little more critical. Besides the mattresses leaning in the halls, my partner saw several mice running across the hallway by the downstairs room. This was a bit off-putting to me. Although I'm sure there are plenty of mice in London, I don't want to see them in the hotel I'm staying in! There was a laundry machine outside, under one of the balconies in the front of the building. We could distinctly hear loud talking in the hallways and from nearby rooms, both late at night and early in the morning. I understand this is not management's fault, but it did detract from our sleep and therefore, my impression of the hotel. Breakfast was fine - cereal, croissant, boiled eggs - typical continental type fare. The hotel served its purpose and was not a *bad* experience, but next time I would hope for a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JLMarietta
Reviews.Content: We traveled to London in May, 2009 with our two adult children. We all enjoyed this hotel. It is within a few blocks from Hyde Park and (in the other direction) a few blocks from the Paddington tube station and Paddington train station (across the street from each other) -- so the location was incredible for public transportation. The room and bathroom were both very comfortable for the four of us. The hotel was quaint and clean. Our kids enjoyed the free internet service in the room, too! A continental breakfast was served with a variety of foods, from beans, to hard boiled eggs, cereal, croissants, fruit, juice, coffee, tea, etc. The staff was very friendly, too. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “In dire need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: stonacrows
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay there after reading some positive reviews on the internet, however I was very dissappointed with the condition of the hotel upon arrival. Looks classy from the street and deserved of the relatively high overnight rate, but the interior is in dire need of repair and upgrade. Stairs are steep and the railing is weak ... all the way to the 4th floor. Most rooms are without shades/curtains, meaning that you can see in from outside at night when the lights are on. Bathrooms are tiny, with poor plumbing, bad lighting and no exhaust. Toilet seat broken and needs 3 or more flushes to remove waste. Bedroom also very tiny, even smaller than the tiny rooms you come to expect in the UK. Windows had cracked panes and had no locks. Anyone could open them ... if they dared. We had a wire-sprung mattress ... more wire than padding, definitely in need of replacement. The breakfast was the usual continental style, and I must make a special mention about the toast. One minute we see a woman (owner/cleaner who knows?) through the dining room window pushing clothes into the washing machine ... next second she's buttering toast and serving the guests ... without washing her hands. No wonder disease spreads! All in all, despite the great location, my family and I would never stay there again, and we'd recommend to others not to waste their money there either. Friendly, courteous staff, but a real hovel of a place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and friendly”
Reviews.Author: tugatourist
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a 3 night weekend with my wife. It's near lancaster gate tube station and near Nothing Hill. We stayed in room nÂº9 on 2nd floor. It doesn't have elevator. The reception is normal, we asked were was the portobello market, and the guy tha was in the desk didn't know. And the market it's very near the hotel... The room was nice, good bed and clean. A lot of tv channels and a small but complete bathroom. The negative points: for the 3 nights we stayed there, they never changed the towels. The breakfast is poor, no bread or fruit in the table. I reccomend this hotel for couples who want a room just for sleep and take a bath.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cats_123
Reviews.Content: Allocated `family room' on the GF next to reception. Good quality room nicely decorated. Sky TV (but not the sports channels!). Remarkably quiet given the location. Was a little cold as the `Dimplex' (night storage) heaters didn't seem to work, but they had provided a free standing heater. Paid Â£55 so can have no complaints. This price included breakfast (which you rarely get for that price). Simple continental breakfast with boiled eggs, toast, baked beans plus croissants, cornflakes, weetabix and fruit juices/ tea/coffee. The hotel is very close to Paddington stations and Lancaster Gate with plenty of local amenities just up the road. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: revlisSlo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Piccolino for 3 nights in a family room (quad) and I have to say everything was just as it is described on the hotel`s website. The room was sufficiently big and very clean for London standards the staff was friendly and the continental breakfast was above average (classic+eggs, beans, fresh fruit,...). Aside from a broken drawer and kettler(only thing that was not clean enough) everything was ok and in working order.. In my opinion this is a fantastic hotel for the price you pay considering you are practically staying in the heart of London. So anyone searching for a budget hotel in Paddington this is definitely a safe choice - nothing fancy, just reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Piccolino never again”
Reviews.Author: Paris_Phantom
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the previous reviews, we must have been giving the room from hell. The toilet seat was broken, they did fix it. The toilet would not flush and the cistern housing was broken. The TV did not work very well as it had no signal. The window rattled in the wind and would not close properly. The cleaning staff decided after 2 days we were no longer a couple and only gave us one towel. The wash room was 900mm wide by about 1600mm long and contained the shower, the wash basin and the toilet. Any food that was put out for breakfast was cold. Baked been and hard boiled eggs. OK it was in a great location, but it would only suit a one night stopover as far as we are concerned. The London Guards is way better, however bit further away from Paddington. Front desk staff were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Heathrow”
Reviews.Author: Kiwitraveller_8
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location near to Paddington Station for trains to Heathrow. The location was good. The hotel was OK for the price but needed some TLC. There was mould in the showers, and the window was broken, with an ill functioning lock.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay at Piccolino Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hengame
Reviews.Content: I was the first Iranian guest for Piccolino Hotel. I have enjoyed a lot to stay at Piccolono Hotel with its warm atmosphere. The hotel is located at nice area close to subway. It was really convenient for me travel back and forth between London down town and Hotel. I appropriate all good tips that I got from the Hotel managers specially Moheed. I am really recommending this Hotel for everybody who would like to enjoy and have a nice memory of stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in London!”
Reviews.Author: tutor63
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 3 days in middle of September 2008 and was impressed with the high quality of service of all the staff especially the boss of the place and manager Tipu. Rate charged was a bargain with good quality room. The double ensuite room was spacious and clean. Towels and toilet were cleaned and tidled everyday. Wireless internet was free and shower was excellent with hot water. Bed was comfortable too. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with Piccolino”
Reviews.Author: bwhit
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the cleanliness of this hotel and very appreciative of the helpfulness and cordiality of the staff--Azeem, Moheed, and others whose names I did not learn. I have stayed in several modestly priced London hotels over the years and am happy to say that I have finally found one I will return to on future stays in the Paddington area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Piccolino Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheila-Claudio
Reviews.Content: On June I travelled with my husband to England and in London we stayed at Piccolino HOtel. It was great!! Hotel Managers Moheed and Azeem were excellent, very helpful and were always servicing all our needs. The hotel is wonderfull, located near Hyde Park and a block from Paddington Station. Regarding its facilities the room was very clean and confortable, breakfast was delicious and staying at Piccolino made all the difference in our stay in London. We recommend this hotel if you are planning to stay in London. And we recommend Moheed as your personal manager as he will do all he can to satisfy your needs!!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: dave30560
Reviews.Content: We went to see Jack Johnson at Hyde Park great gig, hotel was nice just that they did not have my booking on their system so I was lucky they had a room available but it worked out cheaper so I was happy. I think they have trouble with all the bookings they make which I think is what lets them down but I'm sure if you book direct you would have no problem. Recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: k_maindorge
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel just around the corner from Paddington. My children had never been to London so I booked a quad room. It was lovely, one double bed and two singles. Breakfast consisted of cereal (corn flakes, crunchy nut cornflakes or weetabix), loads of toast and fresh fruit and baked beans. My only problem with the hotel was the size of the breakfast room but other than this it was great. The staff are lovely and friendly and our bedroom was spotless. If I ever go to London again I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: CJ78
Reviews.Content: I booked a twin room for 2 nights at this hotel via the hotels on-line reservation system. This system confirmed the room was available and payment was taken from my account via Paypal. I did not receive confirmation via email from the hotel itself, so thought it wise to contact them directly to confirm they had received my payment. I received an email in response to inform me that they were booked out!! This is despite the online reservation system saying the room was available and them taking payment from me for the room. On principal i would advise not to stay here, however if you do still want to, and use the online system - make sure you confirm with the hotel that the requested room is actually available.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain”
Reviews.Author: Motherian
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 Night stay. Excellent value for money. Very helpful staff- even carried our suitcases upstairs. Couple of minor problems with room on arrival (eg missing bulb in bedside lamp) but this was sorted very quickly. Breakfast was good, although limited choice. Room was fine, very clean with hairdryer, tea/coffee making and colour tv with digital channels. Ensuite was compact, but also nicely decorated and clean. Location excellent, only a few minutes from Paddington, and about 20 min walk to Oxford Street. This is definately the best small hotel I've used in London, and I will use it in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, great for price”
Reviews.Author: ros22
Reviews.Content: Myself nand my boyfriend stayed here just last weekend annd it was gret for the price, room was small size no room between bed and wall, bathroom was tiny also and needed to be painted badly otherwise was very clean, breakfast was adequate. NO lift and we were on third floor and after a day of exploring lonon a long walk up stairs is not welcome,very central however, with Lancaster Gate tube station 5 minutes walk away only. Staff were unfriendly and had VERY bad english, diidnt understand when I asked her for a cereal bowl !!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Generally okay”
Reviews.Author: CarolinePenny
Reviews.Content: Good price/quality, it is a relatively cheap hotel and you get value for the money you've paid, but be willing to deal with the shortcomings. The room was small, but had everything it needed. It was elegantly decorated with lovely sheets and curtains and the bed was very comfortable. A big plus is that everything was very, very clean. (And I am always very weary of this.) No weird stains or smells, nothing. The ensuite bathroom was tiny! But again, very, very clean and just what you needed. A few drawbacks though : the shower head was â€˜repairedâ€™ with duck tape and made things difficult to shower (plenty of hot water though!), the toilet seat was broken, so you had to sit down very carefully or fall off, a drawer in the bedroom wardrobe was falling apart,â€¦etc. The reception area was, like the hotel in general, small but clean. It was no problem arriving early, we could drop off our suitcases and check in later. I wasnâ€™t exactly comfortable with the fact that we just had to leave them beside the reception desk, without any notes of to whom they belonged â€“ anyone could take them. Same when checking out, we had a late train so we left the bags in the hotel, but again- anyone could take them. When collecting our bags in the evening, there were four beside the desk (we only had two) and the receptionist actually asked : â€˜Oh are those four yours?â€™ The hotel seems to be run by foreigners who were adequately friendly, but their English was not that comprehensible and it seemed as if you needed to drag out the information you wanted. On arrival, we had to fill in a whole form with our names, Visa number, nights we were staying, even the amount we needed to pay etc. â€“ which seemed strange to us, we booked through the hotel website so they should have known all these things? Breakfast was nothing fancy, but good enough and filling. There were two kinds of juices, coffee, tea, you could ask for hot chocolate, milk, toast, croissants, cereals, fruits and oatmeal biscuits. The drawback here was that the breakfast room was small and breakfast time is between 7:30 and 9, so itâ€™s not uncommon that youâ€™d have to wait until there was a table available for you. The environment of the hotel is very nice â€“ lots of pubs and places to eat, really lively and cosy but not crowded or noisy or anything. In fact, being in the city centre, we did not have any noise during night time â€“ allowing us to have a good nightâ€™s rest.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Purplelinky
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the hotel with my family: hubbie and 2 teenage kids. We had the family room on the ground floor, which was perfect as it has a wall separating the kids beds from the double bed. The room was very nicely decorated and very clean, I am a bit of a clean fanatic and the first thing I do is inspect the bedding and the drawers, all were very clean. The towels could have been a bit better, they were old and a bit threadbare, but clean, I'm sure they could replace them for not very much?, and the shower could use some bleach on the grout, but over all did appear very clean. The room was very large with a variety of wardropes, bedside tables and drawer units, 2 leather chairs and a dressing area, a large fan was also provided. With all of this plus the two single beds and a large double bed there was still enough room for the four of us to move about in, it never felt crampt. The view from the room was into a small courtyard (no view at all really), we kept all the curtains closed, but given that we were only really in the room at night it did not really matter. The plus point of this was that there was no noise at all at night, we have never slept so well! The breakfast suited all of us, even my fussy daughter, my son who has food allergies and myself - vegetarian. There was always lots of fresh fruit, and they constantly refilled the milk and fruit juice jugs. I would think that some may be dissapointed not to get a full english, perhaps this could be considered? The hotel is in an ideal situation, we paid Â£8 for a taxi from Euston when we arrived but after that we used the tube just around the corner. To sum up, I would stay at the hotel again, and I would recommend it to anyone, it was clean, central, good value and the staff were all very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jean_Francois_Deboi
Reviews.Content: hello, I booked this Hotel on my travel agent's advise as I wanted a budget hotel for this trip. At first i thaught it would be a small average hotel like the price i was paying but it came out to be a pretty good place. the first thing that touched me was the smiling receptionest, smile which is becoming a scarce commodity in my own country France and in other european countries where i travel frequently. I was reached earlier than my check in time and was expecting to wait for 2 hours but they accomodated and best of all I wasnt charged anything extra. Piccolino has neat and clean rooms, clean tolittes. I can live without food but cant live with unclean room and toilette. Though I'd apprecaite if they start serving meals too I mean lunches and dinners.The staff deserves a word of gratitude as i was in londo n for busines and needed to use the internet alot, but my laptop developed soem problem and wouldnt work. I reqeusted the reseptionsit to help me find an internet cafe where I could use internet, he offered to check my laptop and was surpised when in 2 minutes he was there and after an hour of labour he fixed the problem, best of all i wasnt charged anything. In short, a good value for money. Decent and tasetefully decorated property. I am certainly going to recommen to my friends and family who hop into london now and then The hotel is at the central location. So travellers like me who have busines all day and come back to thier hotel in the evening, can go out for a walk around the central london area after refreshing. Piccolino Highly recomended! Jean Fracois ( please pardon my emglish, I am French speaking and am only learning english these days)

Reviews.Title: “Very Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Goofymimi
Reviews.Content: The Piccolino Hotel is a great disappointment for us. Thanks to the VERY DECEIVING pictures, we were convinced that we got a pretty good hotel deal in London, that is, until we actually saw our room. First of all the room was very uncomfortably small, looked nothing like in the picture. Two people cannot go around the room without bumping into one another. All the furniture was cramped together. For example, the fridge was placed in a corner which is very hard to reach. What made it worst was that due to lack of space, a night stand was placed directly in front of the fridge so one could never really open the fridge without first moving the night stand away. We got the night stand in a way that we could open the fridge about 30 degrees, just barely enough to put some water bottles in the fridge. There was insufficient plug at the wall, so one has to decide whether he wants fridge or he wants light. We decided on fridge since more light would bring more disappointment for us about the room. Second, there was a TV, except that again due to lack of space, the TV was placed behind the hotel door, the view was obstructed by a wall so that one could not lie comfortably in the bed and watch TV. You really have to pull a chair and sit in front of it and strain your neck to watch the TV placed close to the ceiling. On the first day, upon arrival and wanting a glass of warm tea, we discovered that the water cooker in the room was broken. We had to struggle a bit with the wire cable to get the TV turned on. The bathroom had a very intense strong smell, not to mention that it was super tiny. Anyone who is slightly overweight will have problem fitting in the bathroom or sitting on the toilet. The hotel stay does include a breakfast, which was the worst breakfast at any hotels Iâ€™ve ever stayed. Two different types of cereals, toast, croissant, and beans were included on top of the normal tea and coffee. A few fruits were also available. The croissant was the worst I ever had, dense like a brick. We noticed that none of the guests finished the croissant in their plates. We never touched the croissant again after that day. The best is yet to come. On the second day when we came back to the hotel room, we found out that our towels werenâ€™t where they were â€“ on the chair, rather, they were thrown randomly on the bathroom floor â€“ next to the toilet, one covering the toilet brush! We could not bring ourselves to use those towels again and so had to ask for new one from the front desk. The next day during breakfast, we got the usual toast since we had absolutely no appetite for the brick croissant. I took a few bites on the toast before discovering that one of the toasts was completely moldy!! Ewww! I checked all the others, although they were fine I still lost appetite for anymore toast at the hotel. We sticked to the English breakfast offered at some cafeteria on the way to the train station at 4 pounds that day onwards. Although the incidents werenâ€™t severe, but it showed that the hotel owner and staffs werenâ€™t committed on delivering a good hotel service. Hygiene was definitely NOT rated very important in running the hotels. I am very disappointed at this hotel. I think the money was not well spent and I got the worst value out of the money. We will definitely never ever stay there again and will never recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrible, Terrible Place!”
Reviews.Author: Misslady1432
Reviews.Content: I know that everyone is entitled to their opinion, and that everyone as different expectation of an hotel, but from my point of view this was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had the misfortune to endure. And I am exceptionally angry at the people who wrote nice things about this place because it is through their reviews that I thought it would be a decent place to stay instead of the dirty hellhole it in fact turned out to be. The entire hotel is filthy, badly run, and staffed with unhelpful, unfriendly people who thinks itâ€™s funny when your complain about how bad things are. Myself and my daughter went down to London on business for six nights, and therefore wanted something reasonable and clean, and for almost eighty pounds per night, while you know youâ€™re not going to get outstanding, I expected at least a basic degree of comfort and cleanliness. Instead, the room we were put in was absolutely filthy. Every towel and sheet was covered in dark brown stains, caused no doubt by the fact that they, and I use this term loosely, â€œwashâ€� such things in an outside space underneath the main entrance next to bags of rubbish. This being a big deal for me when I travel, I asked for new bedding and towels, only to be given even filthier ones that I wouldnâ€™t let a dog sleep on. Bottom line, We reached such a level of despair with the situation that we went out and brought new sheets and towels from a store nearby, just after we went around trying to find alternative accommodation. We then had to spend extra time and money in a launderette cleaning these items and some of the hotels own things because the management couldnâ€™t see anything wrong with them. The place is, in a word, a hovel! Lights donâ€™t work and are broken. There is dirt and grim everywhere that the cleaners canâ€™t be bothered to clean. Tables are thick in black dirt that shows that they havenâ€™t been cleaned in ages. Toilet seats are broken. It takes ages to flush waste away. The shower had hair caught all the way around the door. Wardrobes are crooked. Drinking glasses have cracks in them. The kettle provided has filth and grim at the bottom, while the cups clearly havenâ€™t been washed from their last use. The maids walk around cursing in either Polish or Russian because they donâ€™t like doing anything other than smoke in the hallways and hover the stairs, which they are always doing because plaster is falling off the walls and covering the carpet. Even something like a â€™Do not disturbâ€™ sign has been stolen from another hotel, and it doesnâ€™t end there. The stairs are steep, and if you stay in the attic (which tends to leak in, by all accounts), there is no handrail to hold onto. This is also true of the breakfast area, which is underground and is not easy to reach if you are disabled in any way. There is damp patches on the hallways walls, and bits of wooden skirting board lying around with nails sticking out of it, which is just the sort of thing you want to see if you should have little children with you. Breakfast is yet another farce. I know that it is only a basic continental breakfast, but when we went down once at about eight in the morning, all their was was two little bowls of cereal laid out on a trestle table. No milk, no toast, no buns, no nothing. And the only answer you get if you complain is â€˜Well, no one else has complainedâ€™. This is their get out of jail free card; something they use to let themselves of the hook for the appalling condition of the hotel and to make you feel as though you are being unreasonable for asking for anything better. I donâ€™t care if no one else has complained before. I found it completely unacceptable, and I find the idea of being treated like a third class citizen because I wanted to pay a reasonable price for a hotel instead of the extortionate fees charged by other London hotels unacceptable, so I decided that before I left, I would make my feelings clear in a letter to the management that I left on the door. I will admit that my language wasnâ€™t the nicest, but the experience was so terrible that I wasnâ€™t interested in being gracious to ungracious hosts. This was when one of the men who runs the hotel decided to chase after myself and my daughter and scream insults at us from across the street. They are rude people running a vile hotel, and anyone who says otherwise mustnâ€™t have any sort of standards when it comes to where they stay. So for anyone thinking of going to this hotel, and is fooled by the deceptive photographs and so-called â€˜reasonableâ€˜ price tag, be aware that this is a terrible place and look elsewhere, as anything would be better than this.

Reviews.Title: “loved the piccolino”
Reviews.Author: zara_abbas
Reviews.Content: a very pleasent hotel, situated very close to paddington tube station and hyde park. nice comfortable rooms, with tea/cofee making facilities, sky channels , direct dialing, hair dryers and washroom amenities. Good helpfull staff, offered welcome drinks on arrival. Initialy had problems with room alocated on the top floor, but the staff immediately responded to my requested and sorted out a room on the first floor. we would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Riotstar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Piccolino twice now and found it was comfortable both times. The staff are very pleasant, and the location - just down the road from Paddington station - is excellent. The Bakerloo line from Paddington is great for getting around the city. Hyde park is just down the road, and there is a very nice pub, the Queen Victoria, just a few doors down for the hotel. The rooms very basic but comfortable. On my first stay, in 2005, the room was lovely, but without a view. On the second, in 2006, we were rather disturbed by the boiler in the attic, but the room itself was comfortable. The breakfast is good, with lots of coffee or tea, cereal and mini pastries and fruit, of which you can eat all you like. There is also toast. I liked this hotel, it is a quiet, pleasant base for a visit to the capital and I would recommend it to others for the brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrincessChilli
Reviews.Content: A good budget hotel close to Paddinton Station and in a safe quiet area. Very helpful staff and someone on the desk 24 hours. Rooms are small but thats what you expect. Fruit, cereal, toast coffee or tea for breakfast, nothing fancy, but it was breakfast. We stayed two nights. We are a senior couple and they had booked us on third floor but changed us to the first and helped us with out bags. Twin beds were comfortable and the free wireless internet was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Bayswater”
Reviews.Author: azizahhane
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the hotel for the 3rd year in a row, thanks to the effort of the hotel's staff that made our stay a comfortable one. The staff was ever so friendly and willing to help us in finding our way around the area concerning local restaurants etc. We will definately recommend this hotel if you are looking for a cheap and good accommodation in London (staying in the Bayswater area). From, Lars & Azizah

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, good location”
Reviews.Author: Pavement-Walker
Reviews.Content: Pleasant small hotel in the hotel-dense area near Paddington, along and just off Sussex Gardens. This one is just five minutes from Paddington, straight up the street, and not much longer the other way to Hyde Park, ideal when the sun is shining. I asked for and got a quiet room at the back. Very pleasant reception person. While the en suite toilet, sink, shower is a triumph of design over physical space, it was nicely tiled with modern fittings and plenty of hot water in the well working shower. The beds were fine and the TV included a wide range of Sky channels. The breakfast is advertised as "continental", but no one on the continent would put up with a rather mediocre selection of a few cereals and white bread toast. Given the modest price, for London, of a stay here, anyone liking a good breakfast should walk up the road to Paddington Station, there are at least two places open and advertising full breakfast for less than five pounds, and the station concourse has a range of chain food outlets.

HotelInfo.Name: Piccolino Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 14 Sussex Place, London W2 2TP, England
